en.sc1: Class AList stores the list elements in the first listSize contiguous array positions. In this example, listSize is 5.
en.sc2: Array positions correspond to list positions. In other words, the element at position $i$ in the list is stored at array cell $i$. Here, the element at position 3 in the list (and index 3 in the array) is highlighted.
en.sc3: The head of the list is always at position 0.
en.sc4: Random access to any element in the list quite easy. Given some position in the list, the value of the element in that position can be accessed directly.
en.sc5: Thus, access to any element using the moveToPos method followed by the getValue method takes $\Theta(1)$ time.
